Contets: Found in a mural in a Neolithic Grave in Henan Puyang (河南濮陽西水坡新石器時代古墓) clam shells arranged in the shape of Big Dipper in the North (北斗Bei Dou) and below the foot, Tiger in the West and Azure Dragon in the East. Also showing Five Stars.

Map or catalog: Wu Xian Star Map(商巫咸星圖Shang wu Jian xing Tu)
Creator: Wu Xian
Contets: Contained 44 Central and Outer constellations totalling 141 stars

Map or catalog: Warring States Period grave lacquer box(戰國初年湖北隨縣擂鼓墩曾侯乙墓漆箱)
Contets: Indicated location of Big Dipper and 28 Constellations by characters

Map or catalog: Astronomic star observation(天文星占Tian Wen xing zhan)
Creator: Gan De (甘德)
Contets: Contained 75 Central Constellation and 42 Outer Constellations, some said 510 stars in 18 Constellations

Map or catalog: Shi Shen astronomy(石申天文Shi Shen Tian wen)aka. (石氏星经 Shi Shi Xing Jing)
Creator: Shi Shen (石申)
Contets: 138 Constellations and the name of 810 stars, location of 121 stars, some said it contains The 28 Lunar Ecliptic Constellations, 62 Central Constellations and 30 Outer Constellations

Map or catalog: Han Comet Diagrams(湖南長沙馬王堆漢墓帛書)(彗星圖Meng xing Tu)
Contets: Different 29 different types of comets, also record and prediction of positions of Jupiter, Saturn, and Venus during 246–177 B.C.

Map or catalog: Five Star Prediction Device(安徽阜陽五星候占儀)

Creator: Geng Shouchang (耿壽昌)
Time created: 52 BC 甘露二年Gan Lu Er Ren

Map or catalog: First remark of a constellation in observation in Korean history
Contets: The star 'Pae'(a kind of comet) appeared in the constellation Wang Rang

Map or catalog: First Ecliptic Armillary Sphere(黄道仪Huang Dao Yi)
Creator: Jia Kui 贾逵

Map or catalog: Han Grave Mural Star Chart(洛阳西汉墓壁画)(星象图Xing Xiang Tu)
Contets: Sun, Moon and ten other star charts

Map or catalog: Han Dynasty Nanyang Stone Engraving(河南南阳汉石刻画)(行雨图Xing Yu Tu)
Contets: Depicted five stars forming a cross

Map or catalog: Eastern Han Celestial Globe and star maps(浑天仪)(渾天儀圖注,浑天仪图注)(靈憲,灵宪)
Creator: Zhang Heng (张衡)
